channel.title: mypy - Today I Learnt...
channel.description: Recent content in mypy on Today I Learnt...

item.title: Not to union Python list types
item.description: Consider this contrived function which either returns a list of tuples or a list of dicts depending on an argument value:

item.title: How to handle convenience imports with Mypy
item.description: Python convenience imports are where objects are imported into a package’s __init__.

item.title: Mypy skips empty functions
item.description: Mypy doesn’t check types of empty functions, such as those whose implementation is pass, .

item.title: How Django's management commands need to be type hinted
item.description: For Django management commands with arguments, you might not expect Mypy (configured with the django-stubs plugin) to complain about this signature:

item.title: About `mypy`'s unreachable code functionality
item.description: Mypy can be configured to raise an error when it finds unreachable code.

item.title: About `mypy`'s `reveal_type` and `reveal_locals` functions
item.description: Which can be used for debugging type annotation problems.

item.title: That `mypy` only type-checks functions that have at least one type annotation
item.description: This is noted in the common issues and solutions documentation.

item.title: A better way of configuring `mypy`
item.description: I didn’t realise you can put all your config into setup.

item.title: How to use type annotations with Python's `csv` module
item.description: Adding a type annotation for a “writer” object created by csv.
